title: Reservation impls in rustdoc

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: F-rustc_attrs
labels.description: Internal rustc attributes gated on the `#[rustc_attrs]` feature gate.

body:
I’ve been browsing rustdoc and just noticed a very confusing blanket [impl on `Infallible`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.54.0/std/convert/enum.Infallible.html#impl-From%3C!%3E-1).

![Screenshot_20210806_191027](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3986214/128547444-d86f9a18-754d-46c9-8343-61b3808c1a97.png)


Confusing because it’s obviously in conflict with the explicit `From<!> for Infallible` as well as the generic `From<T> for T` implementation. Only after [looking at the source code](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.54.0/src/core/convert/mod.rs.html#559-563) I could find out that this _isn’t even an implementation at all_. Searching for existing issues, the original issue on this topic is closed and concluded

> This is how it currently looks, and I think it's "good enough". Going to close the issue.
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/155238/66155518-ccf30800-e5ed-11e9-8112-c9780ec32dd9.png)
> <hr>
>
> * _source: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/64633#issuecomment-538078589_

This comment however is only visible [on the page of the `From` trait itself](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.54.0/std/convert/trait.From.html#impl-From%3C!%3E-2).

Another example of this problem, [the same `impl` on the `Option<T>` type](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.54.0/std/option/enum.Option.html#impl-From%3C!%3E).

I’m also confused by the fact that the `impl` is only shown on _some_ types in `std` but not all. E.g. [on the `cmp::Ordering` type](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.54.0/std/cmp/enum.Ordering.html#blanket-implementations) you can’t see it at all.

I don’t feel like it would be a difficult change to just make this `From` impl entirely invisible in rustdoc. I don’t see any value in displaying it, and it can be very confusing, especially when displayed without the accompanying comment. 

@rustbot label T-rustdoc, F-rustc_attrs, T-libs-api, A-docs, C-bug

Tagging `T-libs-api, A-docs` as well because the situation could immediately and easily be somewhat improved by adding the “this impl does not yet exist” explanation docs to the `from` method, as that one’s at least being displayed everywhere (if you click the `[+]` button sufficiently often).
